result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal Suzanne Mills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
No contact directly or indirectly with Mariah Klunk or Michael San Fillipo unless agent approves.
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional and take all prescribed medications in manner prescribed.
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
No criminal conduct
Not associate with those who possess illegal controlled substances.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
01:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Crystal Suzanne Mills appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen in court for Crystal Suzanne Mills. 
def wanted her plea/sentencing in person, but no bailiff was available to bring her to court in person. Atty Derksen advises def will waive appearance. Court prints Jury instructions and PTC offer and makes it part of the record.  Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. NC plea entered Count 1, DRI Count 2, No 950 issues. Def makes statement to the Court.

records.addlTxt: 9:48 AM Defendant Crystal Suzanne Mills in court with attorney Zachary Derksen.  Defendant Crystal Suzanne Mills in custody.  Grant D Scaife appeared for the Wisconsin, State of. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court does waiver colloquy. Information filed and accepted. Defense received and waived reading of information. NG plea entered to both counts. Request a STC in 60 days. Defense orally motions for bond modification to a signature bond. State objects to modification. Defendant has an active arrest warrant in Dodge county. Court denies bond motion.
